alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 4:20PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Areas near Ponderosa Park in Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 418 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rainfall has ended. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area due to earlier rainfall. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Orofino Wash, Board Creek, Ash Creek, Milk Creek, Wolf Creek, and Bannon Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Groom Creek Subdivision, Lower Wolf Creek Campground and Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground. - This includes the following swimming holes... Wolf Creek Falls. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
